item.title: STORYTELLING CHALLENGE: What’s your story?
item.dc:creator: Roxanne Joseph
item.description:
We challenge you to re-imagine storytelling Everyone has a story to tell. What’s yours? Do you know of a community who has a gap that needs to be filled or problem solved? What are some of the issues that matter the most to you? The way we tell stories has changed: today, journalism goes beyond […]

The post STORYTELLING CHALLENGE: What’s your story? appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The ‘double agents’ of the local government elections
item.dc:creator: Roxanne Joseph
item.description:
Muzonjani Zulu is so determined to change South Africa and to free it from what he describes is a government of non-intellectuals incapable of running the country, that he decided to contest the local government elections.Zulu is one of thousands of “double-agents” – candidates running for multiple wards and/or multiple parties – who stand to […]

The post The ‘double agents’ of the local government elections appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Dying to be elected: mapping politically-motivated killings
item.dc:creator: Roxanne Joseph
item.description:
Politically-motivated killings in the run-up to the August 3 local government elections have mushroomed, country-wide. Our map of these killings is free-to-use (see embed code and link under the map).   Embed: <iframe src=”https://uploads.knightlab.com/storymapjs/1f1bc5e01ee0c7d6f1ec507ae666361b/ancs-kzn-political-killings/index.html” frameborder=”0″ width=”100%” height=”800″></iframe> Link: https://uploads.knightlab.com/storymapjs/1f1bc5e01ee0c7d6f1ec507ae666361b/ancs-kzn-political-killings/index.html

The post Dying to be elected: mapping politically-motivated killings appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
